channel.title: Moparisthebest Forum Dynamic Stat Signatures by Ron
channel.description:
[b]Moparisthebest Forum Dynamic Stat Signatures by Ron[/b]
Edit: Sorry all, this is temp not available. The code seemed to be working fine, I left for a little while, and I came back and it stopped working. I think it's my host. I'll try to change hosts or something.
Well, I really wanted to make this when xxlegitxx requested it, but at the time, I thought it was impossible. When I started reading more and more about cURL, I figured out, that agreeing to the TOS, logging into moparisthebest forums, and viewing a profile would actually be conceivable. That's when I made this. :)
[img]http://goons.freepgs.com/FUN/mopar_dynamic_sig.php?member=1096&img=true[/img]
If you noticed, there is a GET variable member in the URL. Change that to your profile number, and it will get all the info on your profile and print it out on the page.
Now this is just the beginning. From here on out, it will be all gravy (that means easy.. lol) because all the coding is pretty much done. I would like to make the dynamic stat signatures even better by having someone make a really sweet background because the above image is a little plain. :)
Code is not released since the script is in beta and Username information and Password information are inside.
~Ron :D

item.title: Moparisthebest Forum Dynamic Stat Signatures by Ron
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

lol, I already made it have a background (as you’ve seen in a earlier post)
unfortunately my php file somehow got deleted…
I can’t do it at the moment because I still need to get ready for school in 7 minutes to leave.
I will post the php background once I get home
(or I can try real quick [br][size=1]Posted on: September 04, 2007, 05:10:39 AM[/size][hr]there
[php]$imgfile = “mopar.png”;
$truecolor = imagecreatefrompng($imgfile);

imagealphablending($truecolor, 1);
imagealphablending($img2, 1);

$img = imageColorAllocate($img2,255,255,255);
imageColorTransparent($img2,$img);
imagecopymerge($truecolor, $img2, 0, 0, 0, 0, $w, $h,100);
[/php]

Read full topic
item.source: Moparisthebest Forum Dynamic Stat Signatures by Ron

item.title: Moparisthebest Forum Dynamic Stat Signatures by Ron
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“Bang Train, post:76, topic:136858”]it works on a solid background, thats dark in color. But what about a background?

But they outlining is nice. Needs a few improvements in areas though. Whats your outlining code?[/quote]

I’ll add the background later, maybe tonight.

His code, I don’t know how it works. I removed half of it, which was apparently unnecessary, but don’t know why, and it still works.

[php] imagettftext($img2, 15, 0, 5, 25, $color, $calibri, ucfirst(str_replace(array('.com', '.org'), '', $hostname)) . ' Forums Stats');

//Name
$temp_pos = strpos($html, ‘Name’);
$html = substr($html, $temp_pos);
$value = strip_tags(str_between($html, ‘

’, ‘’));
imagettftext($img2, 9, 0, 5, 45, $color, $calibri, 'Username: ’ . $value);

//Posts
$temp_pos = strpos($html, ‘Posts’);
$html = substr($html, $temp_pos);
$value = strip_tags(str_between($html, ‘

’, ‘’));
$bboxvalues = imagettfbbox(9, 0, $calibri, 'Post Count: ’ . $value);
imagettftext($img2, 9, 0, 345 - $bboxvalues[2], 45, $color, $calibri, 'Post Count: ’ . $value);

//Position
$temp_pos = strpos($html, ‘Position’);
$html = substr($html, $temp_pos);
$value = strip_tags(str_between($html, ‘

’, ‘’));
imagettftext($img2, 9, 0, 5, 60, $color, $calibri, 'Position: ’ . $value);

//Rep
$temp_pos = strpos($html, ‘Rep’);
$html = substr($html, $temp_pos);
$value = strip_tags(str_between($html, ‘

’, ‘’));
$value = preg_replace(’/\D/’, ‘’, $value);
$bboxvalues = imagettfbbox(9, 0, $calibri, 'Rep: ’ . $value);
imagettftext($img2, 9, 0, 345 - $bboxvalues[2], 60, $color, $calibri, 'Rep: ’ . $value);

//Date Registered
$temp_pos = strpos($html, ‘Date Registered’);
$html = substr($html, $temp_pos);
$value = strip_tags(str_between($html, ‘

’, ‘’));
imagettftext($img2, 9, 0, 5, 75, $color, $calibri, 'Date Registered: ’ . $value);

//Last Active
$temp_pos = strpos($html, ‘Last Active’);
$html = substr($html, $temp_pos);
$value = strip_tags(str_between($html, ‘

’, ‘’));
imagettftext($img2, 9, 0, 5, 90, $color, $calibri, 'Last Active: ’ . $value);

//Current Status
if (strpos($html, ‘useron.gif’)) {
$bboxvalues = imagettfbbox(9, 0, $calibri, ‘Currently Online’);
imagettftext($img2, 9, 0, 345 - $bboxvalues[2], 90, $color, $calibri, ‘Currently Online’);
} elseif (strpos($html, ‘useroff.gif’)) {
$bboxvalues = imagettfbbox(9, 0, $calibri, ‘Currently Offline’);
imagettftext($img2, 9, 0, 345 - $bboxvalues[2], 90, $color, $calibri, ‘Currently Offline’);
}

imagestring($img2, 1, imagesx($img2) - 150, 100, ‘Made by R., B.T., Xxl., and K’, $color);
/***************************************************************************************
/
imagefilter($img2, IMG_FILTER_SMOOTH, -6);
/
***************************************************************************************/
imagettftext($img2, 15, 0, 5, 25, $color2, $calibri, ucfirst(str_replace(array(’.com’, ‘.org’), ‘’, $hostname)) . ’ Forums Stats’);
[/php]

The font color ($color) is black… I have no clue how it became white ($color2). The only thing I had to overlay with white was the title text using the very last line.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparisthebest Forum Dynamic Stat Signatures by Ron
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

get the firefox addon that can view headers
search it on google its on a mozedev site

and then when everything is done and you are setting the header to the img/png

add this

header("Exec time: ".$time);

of course u need to add the functions for getting time.
This is a GREAT benchmarking method for gd.

Run it about 10 times and record the exec time and get the average.

p.s. FUCK U MICROSOFT! office 2007 uses .docx files and I have office 2003 on this computer. So glad i brought the cd images on my HD with me. Still a pain in the ass though.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparisthebest Forum Dynamic Stat Signatures by Ron
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

well first of all to make it fare we need to have the same code to retrieve the information but only benchmarking the actual to say-shadow, same size of picture, same background picture same text and all that stuff, yes, I think that static text would be better.
just PM me your source(of getting the text and 1 of your examples on writing it on) if you don’t want to post it.

then I’ll send you my version made, and lets use microtime as a reference to the benchmark?
[br][hr]well xxlegitxx and I worked on it, and here are the two outcomes
[center]Mine(updated with image)

His
[/center]
The colors may be different for the background but ohh well.

Ohh and also these were the results to the benchmark

and yes, these are averages

mine functions around
0.131973
his functions around
0.384904
in microtime

item.title: Moparisthebest Forum Dynamic Stat Signatures by Ron
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

We could do the bench-marking on my server; I could set it up. Bang Train needs only give pointers if he’s busy. We need to do it with more words, though they would be static text to cut out on connection issues and other uncontrollable factors. Anyway, your way is probably better, because my way doesn’t allow anything with RGB values of greater than 200 on anti-aliased fonts.

item.title: Moparisthebest Forum Dynamic Stat Signatures by Ron
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

but how the heck did you do that pixel scan thing anyway? that was very… different(for php in my idea)
[br][size=1]Posted on: September 03, 2007, 01:23:48 PM[/size][hr]This may be a double post, but since it is merging and I want the last post date to be updated here it goes.
I worked with it a bit and here is the outcome, but it isn’t as exact as a 1 pixel border.

this is with a background(if you don’t see anything, it is likely that I am still working with it in order to not effect the background with my method.
[br]

Ok, now that I got the background thing working
my theory worked as well, however I do not know how CPU-intensive mine is.
How about a bench-marking contest, eh, Bang Train?

kloplop321:

I’ll take a look at my idea on using kind of a layer and blur black, then overlay with white theory of mine

Yea, try that out and see how it turns out. The only thing is that we really only need to take the text layers and expand everything by 1 pixel, and overlay with white text. I think a gaussian blur would be overdoing it.

item.title: Moparisthebest Forum Dynamic Stat Signatures by Ron
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

well, pixel stretch can only work so well, give a gradual bend on the last 5 pixels to merge(dunno how to do that though) or a border…

EDIT:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:58, topic:136858”]I wrote code to make it outline everything white with black, but it’s bulky and cpu-intensive. It goes through every pixel and sees if it is white. If so, it makes the surrounding non-white pixels black.
[/quote]
I like the outline as it shows contrast, and easy to read, however, if it is CPU-intensive, we need to find a better way.

item.title: Moparisthebest Forum Dynamic Stat Signatures by Ron
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

therealjdb:

legit, how about like a darkish blue background with the mopar logo in the center? if you’re interested I could make up a few different examples if you give me some ideas, or of course you could do it yourself but I’m more than willing to help with this.

Something more solid/gradient/repetitive would be best. The image you made is great. But as a background, it’s too flashy. It needs to be toned down a bit. And the way I set up my outlining procedure, you can’t have anything with RGB values higher than 200 lol.

A darkish blue background with the mopar logo is great. We could keep it simple initially, just get it in there to see how it looks, then build upon it.

Read full topic
